meanings.definition: To examine or dissect a body or organ for scientific study.
meanings.sent1: The students will prosect a frog in biology class tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: Scientists prosected the brain to study its structure.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat tried to prosect the toy mouse to understand how it worked.
meanings.sent4: She decided to prosect her thoughts to uncover the root of her anxiety.
meanings.sent5: The archaeologist carefully prosected the ancient artifact to reveal its secrets.

meanings.definition: A specimen prepared for dissection or examination.
meanings.sent1: The prosect of the flower showed intricate details under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The biology lab had a collection of prosects for students to study.
meanings.sent3: The prosect of the butterfly was so delicate that it seemed like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: The prosect of the rock sample revealed hidden minerals within.
meanings.sent5: The museum displayed a rare prosect of a dinosaur fossil for visitors to admire.

meanings.definition: The act of dissecting or examining a body or organ for scientific purposes.
meanings.sent1: The prosect of the heart was a crucial step in the medical research.
meanings.sent2: The prosect of the fish provided valuable insights into its anatomy.
meanings.sent3: During the science fair, the students presented their prosect of a cow's eye.
meanings.sent4: The prosect of the plant specimen revealed unique cellular structures.
meanings.sent5: The prosect of the insect showcased its intricate internal organs.
